page.title: 04Gergask School-Laggan Bridge
page.content: One small school,established 1873 by the education Scotland act(1872),caters for the education of all children aged 5-12 years.The school roll has fallen from 30 to 10 pupils in a space of 4 years.The bulk of the younger population being of high school age now attend Kingussie High School and travel daily by bus a journey of 12 miles.Sometimes in very bad winter weather.Pupils at the village school enjoy a full range of learning skills.They can relax at games in the school field with its own burn for fishing.All children study projects involving maths and language arts as well as practical skills.Those capable and willing can attend college or university away from home.
